intro: Chelonanthus matogrossensis, commonly known as the Matogrossense Chelonanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features include a woody stem and capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
